etymology.description: 幣(幣) (bì, "currency") with 敝(敝) (bì, "damaged") → replaced by 丿(丿) for simplification
etymology.interpretation: The character 币(幣) (bì, "currency") is simplified from 幣(幣) by replacing the component 敝(敝) (bì, "damaged") with a simpler stroke 丿(丿), maintaining the phonetic and semantic elements while making it easier to write.
etymology.simplification: The simplification process involved replacing 敝(敝) (bì, "damaged") with the simpler 丿(丿). This serves to streamline the character for more efficient writing.

examples.chinese: 数字币推动金融创新(數字幣推動金融創新)。
他从国外带回古董币(他從國外帶回古董幣)，准备收藏(準備收藏)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng guówài dài huí gǔdǒng bì, zhǔnbèi shōucáng.
examples.english: He brought back antique currency from abroad and plans to collect it.

examples.chinese: 这个币代表了历史文化(這個幣代表了歷史文化)，价值连城(價值連城)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège bì dàibiǎo le lìshǐ wénhuà, jiàzhí liánchéng.
examples.english: This currency represents historical culture and is extremely valuable.
